subject: Re: Re: A shipment from order #SSN1850 has been delivered
description_text:
Hello,

I finally found a USB port where the shifter will work. Why does it only work in certain ports and not all?

Thanks,

Jeff Sparks

________________________________
From: service@simsonn.com <service@simsonn.com>
Sent: Tuesday, July 15, 2025 11:16 PM
To: captain.sparks@comcast.net <captain.sparks@comcast.net>
Subject: Re: Re: A shipment from order #SSN1850 has been delivered

Hi captain. sparks@comcast. net,

Please provide a video showing the issue where the product is not working properly. We need to identify the problem before proceeding to the next steps.
We’re committed to helping you resolve the issue, and if it turns out to be unresolvable, we will arrange a refund. However, we must first try to address and fix the problem.


On Sun, 13 Jul at 12:22 PM , captain. sparks@comcast. net <captain.sparks@comcast.net> wrote:
Hello,  please send a call tag so I can return this inoperative shifter and please refund my payment.

Thank you.

Jeff Sparks

Sent from my T-Mobile 5G Device


-------- Original message --------
From: service@simsonn.com
Date: 7/4/25 6:55 AM (GMT-07:00)
To: captain.sparks@comcast.net
Subject: Re: Re: A shipment from order #SSN1850 has been delivered

Hi captain. sparks@comcast. net,


We will notify our tech support to help you see what's going on, you can provide more information and you can take a video. We're sorry for the trouble we caused you, and we'll try to fix it for you, as soon as possible.

On Thu, 3 Jul at 12:43 PM , captain. sparks@comcast. net <captain.sparks@comcast.net> wrote:
Hello,

Yes my shifter was delivered but it doesn't work. The computer and your software don't recognize that it is plugged in. I've tried two different cables, including the one provided with the shifter. I've tried different USB ports with no luck. It does seem to be powered since the buttons light up blue when pressed and there is a white glow inside the shifter but other than that it's dead.

Is there some special procedure required or something I'm missing to make this functional?

Thanks,

Jeff Sparks
________________________________
From: SIMSONN <service@simsonn.com>

conversations.body_text: Hi captain. sparks@comcast. net,     The reason is that these ports provide unstable power, which may cause the device to malfunction.
